Package: org.ajoberstar.gradle.git.release.semver

[Groovy] Class StrategyUtil

    • org.ajoberstar.gradle.git.release.semver.StrategyUtil

    • Utility class to more easily create PartialSemVerStrategy instances.

      • Methods Summary

          Methods 
          Type Name and description
          static PartialSemVerStrategy all(PartialSemVerStrategy... strategies)
          Creates a strategy that applies all of the given strategies in order.
          static PartialSemVerStrategy closure(groovy.lang.Closure<SemVerStrategyState> behavior)
          Creates a strategy backed by the given closure.
          static SemVerStrategyState incrementNormalFromScope(SemVerStrategyState state, ChangeScope scope)
          Increments the nearest normal version using the specified scope.
          static PartialSemVerStrategy one(PartialSemVerStrategy... strategies)
          Creates a strategy that applies each strategy in order, until one changes the state, which is then returned.
          static int parseIntOrZero(java.lang.String str)
          Returns the int value of a string or returns 0 if it cannot be parsed.

      • Method Detail

        • static final PartialSemVerStrategy all(PartialSemVerStrategy... strategies)

          Creates a strategy that applies all of the given strategies in order.

        • static final PartialSemVerStrategy closure(groovy.lang.Closure<SemVerStrategyState> behavior)

          Creates a strategy backed by the given closure. It should accept and return a SemVerStrategyState.

        • static final SemVerStrategyState incrementNormalFromScope(SemVerStrategyState state, ChangeScope scope)

          Increments the nearest normal version using the specified scope.

        • static final PartialSemVerStrategy one(PartialSemVerStrategy... strategies)

          Creates a strategy that applies each strategy in order, until one changes the state, which is then returned.

        • static final int parseIntOrZero(java.lang.String str)

          Returns the int value of a string or returns 0 if it cannot be parsed.
